conclusion: Block P has an initial velocity v_0 along the inclined plane.
Block Q is initially at rest (v_Q = 0).
The angle of the inclined plane is θ.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between Q and the inclined plane is μ_k = tan θ.
The normal force N acting on block Q is given by: N = mg cos θ
The frictional force f acting on block Q is: f = μ_k N = tan θ · mg cos θ = mg sin θ
Since the collision is elastic, both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved.
The total momentum before the collision is: m v_0 + 4m · 0 = m v_0
After the collision, let the velocities be v_{P_1} and v_{Q_1}. The total momentum after the collision is: m v_{P_1} + 4m v_{Q_1} = m v_0
The total kinetic energy before the collision is: 1/2 m v_0^2
The total kinetic energy after the collision is: 1/2 m v_{P_1}^2 + 1/2 (4m) v_{Q_1}^2 = 1/2 m v_0^2
From Equation 1, solve for v_{P_1}: v_{P_1} = v_0 - 4 v_{Q_1}
